examples.sentence: Native vs Sino Numbers - Two systems
Counter System Basics - How counters work
Specific counters - When to use what

sections.heading: What is つ (tsu)?
sections.content:
つ is the general counter in Japanese, used for counting most everyday objects that don't require a specific counter. It uses native Japanese numbers and is one of the most versatile and commonly used counters.

りんごを3つ買いました "I bought 3 apples" 質問が2つあります "I have 2 questions"

sections.heading: Complete つ Counter List (1-10)
sections.content:
| Number | Hiragana | Romaji | Kanji | | ------ | -------- | --------- | ----- | | 1 | ひとつ | hitotsu | 一つ | | 2 | ふたつ | futatsu | 二つ | | 3 | みっつ | mittsu | 三つ | | 4 | よっつ | yottsu | 四つ | | 5 | いつつ | itsutsu | 五つ | | 6 | むっつ | muttsu | 六つ | | 7 | ななつ | nanatsu | 七つ | | 8 | やっつ | yattsu | 八つ | | 9 | ここのつ | kokonotsu | 九つ | | 10 | とお | too | 十 |

Important: Native counters are rarely used above 10!

children.heading: 1. General Objects Without Specific Counter
children.content:
When you don't know or need a specific counter:

問題が5つあります "There are 5 problems" 理由が3つあります "There are 3 reasons" アイデアが2つあります "I have 2 ideas"

children.heading: 2. Foods and Grocery Items
children.content: りんごを4つ買いました "I bought 4 apples" 卵を10個ください (can also say: 卵を10買いました) "10 eggs, please" パンを2つください "2 breads, please"

children.heading: 3. Abstract Concepts
children.content: 質問が3つあります "I have 3 questions" 選択肢が4つあります "There are 4 choices" 意見が2つあります "There are 2 opinions"

children.heading: 4. Small Items or Things
children.content: お土産を3つもらいました "I received 3 souvenirs" プレゼントを2つ買いました "I bought 2 presents"

children.heading: 5. When Counter is Unclear
children.content:
If you're unsure which specific counter to use, つ is always safe:

これを2つください "2 of these, please" あれを5つ持ってきて "Bring 5 of those"

children.heading: Both Are Acceptable
children.content:
For many items, you can use either つ or a specific counter:

りんごを3つ ✓ りんごを3個 ✓ "3 apples" ペンを2つ ✓ ペンを2本 ✓ "2 pens"

children.heading: Specific Counter Sounds More Natural
children.content:
While つ works, specific counters sound more precise:

More casual: 紙を3つ ⚠️ More natural: 紙を3枚 ✓ "3 sheets of paper" More casual: 犬を2つ ❌ (sounds odd) Correct: 犬を2匹 ✓ "2 dogs"

children.heading: When つ is Preferred
children.content: Casual conversation Abstract concepts When specific counter is unknown Mixed or unclear items

children.heading: Object + を + つ Counter
children.content: みかんを5つ買った "I bought 5 oranges" クッキーを3つ食べた "I ate 3 cookies" お土産を2つもらった "I received 2 souvenirs"

children.heading: つ Counter + の + Noun
children.content: 3つのりんご "3 apples" 2つの理由 "2 reasons" 5つの質問 "5 questions"

children.heading: Subject + が + つ Counter + Verb
children.content: 問題が4つあります "There are 4 problems" 選択肢が3つあります "There are 3 choices"

children.heading: いくつ - "How many?"
children.content: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" いくつ買いますか？ "How many will you buy?" いくつ欲しいですか？ "How many do you want?" いくつ必要ですか？ "How many do you need?"

children.heading: Answering
children.content: Q: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" A: 3つあります "There are 3" A: 5つです "5"

sections.heading: Above 10: Switch to Sino Numbers
sections.content:
After 10, switch to Sino-Japanese numbers with 個 (こ):

1-10: つ counter ひとつ、ふたつ、みっつ... とお 11+: 個 counter 11個 (じゅういっこ) 15個 (じゅうごこ) 20個 (にじゅっこ) 100個 (ひゃっこ)

Exception: You might hear とお for 10, but above that, always use 個 or another specific counter.

children.heading: Small つ (っ) Sound
children.content:
Notice the small っ in several numbers:

みっつ (3) よっつ (4) むっつ (6) やっつ (8)

The small っ creates a brief pause/stop:

みっつ = mi-t-tsu (not mi-tsu) やっつ = ya-t-tsu (not ya-tsu)

children.heading: Long Vowels
children.content: ここのつ = ko-ko-no-tsu とお = to-o (long "o" sound)

sections.heading: Numbers Above 10 (with 個)
sections.content:
When counting more than 10 items:

11 = じゅういっこ 12 = じゅうにこ 13 = じゅうさんこ 20 = にじゅっこ 30 = さんじゅっこ 50 = ごじゅっこ 100 = ひゃっこ

children.heading: Example 1: Shopping
children.content: A: みかんをいくつ買いますか？ "How many oranges will you buy?" B: 5つください "5, please" A: はい、かしこまりました "Yes, certainly"

children.heading: Example 2: At Home
children.content: A: りんごがいくつありますか？ "How many apples are there?" B: 3つあります "There are 3" A: じゃあ、2つ食べてもいい？ "Then, can I eat 2?" B: いいよ "Sure"

children.heading: Example 3: Classroom
children.content: A: 質問がいくつありますか？ "How many questions do you have?" B: 2つあります "I have 2" A: どうぞ "Go ahead"

children.heading: Example 4: Planning
children.content: A: 選択肢がいくつありますか？ "How many options are there?" B: 4つあります "There are 4" A: 一つずつ説明してください "Please explain them one by one"

children.heading: 一つ (ひとつ)
children.content:
Can mean "one" or "a certain":

一つお願いがあります "I have one favor to ask" 一つの方法 "One method" 一つ言わせてください "Let me say one thing"

children.heading: 二つ (ふたつ)
children.content: 二つの選択肢 "Two choices" 二つ返事 "Immediate reply" (idiom)

children.heading: いくつか (ikutsuka)
children.content:
"Some/several":

いくつか質問があります "I have some questions" いくつか方法があります "There are several methods"

children.heading: いくつも (ikutsumo)
children.content:
"Many":

いくつも問題がある "There are many problems" いくつも買いました "I bought many"

children.heading: 〜ずつ (each/apiece)
children.content: 2つずつください "2 each, please" 一つずつ取ってください "Please take one at a time" 3つずつ分けましょう "Let's divide into groups of 3"

children.heading: 〜くらい/ぐらい (about)
children.content: 3つくらい "About 3" 5つぐらい欲しい "I want about 5"

children.heading: 〜しか (only)
children.content: 2つしかない "There are only 2" 一つしか食べなかった "I only ate one"

sections.heading: Age Usage (Informal)
sections.content:
つ can informally indicate age for young children:

A: いくつ？ "How old?" B: 5つ "5 (years old)"

More formal: 5 歳 (ごさい)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using つ above 10
children.content: Wrong: じゅうつ ❌ Right: 10個 (じゅっこ) ✓ "10 (items)" Wrong: じゅういちつ ❌ Right: 11個 (じゅういっこ) ✓ "11 (items)"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong pronunciation
children.content: Wrong: みつつ (3) ❌ Right: みっつ ✓ Wrong: むつつ (6) ❌ Right: むっつ ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using with living things inappropriately
children.content: Sounds odd: 人を3つ ❌ Correct: 人を3人 (さんにん) ✓ "3 people" Sounds odd: 犬を2つ ❌ Correct: 犬を2匹 (にひき) ✓ "2 dogs"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Forgetting to use a counter
children.content: Wrong: りんごを3買いました ❌ Right: りんごを3つ買いました ✓ "I bought 3 apples"

children.heading: Casual Speech
children.content:
Often drop particles:

Very casual: これ3つ More complete: これを3つ "3 of these" Casual: りんご2つちょうだい Complete: りんごを2つください "2 apples, please"

children.heading: Written/Formal
children.content: 選択肢が4つございます "There are 4 options" (formal) 理由を3つ挙げます "I will raise 3 reasons"

children.heading: つ - Native, casual, 1-10
children.content: 3つ (みっつ) "3 (things)" Used for: general items, 1-10 range

children.heading: 個 - Sino, can be used for all numbers
children.content:
3個 (さんこ) "3 (small objects)" Used for: small, discrete objects, any number

Both are often interchangeable for everyday items!

children.heading: Basic
children.content: りんごを3つ買いました "I bought 3 apples" 質問が2つあります "I have 2 questions" お土産を5つもらいました "I received 5 souvenirs"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 選択肢が4つありますが、どれがいいですか？ "There are 4 options, which is good?" 一つずつ説明してください "Please explain one by one" いくつか問題があります "There are several problems"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: この問題には3つの解決方法があります "There are 3 solutions to this problem" 彼女は一つも間違えなかった "She didn't make a single mistake" いくつもの困難を乗り越えた "I overcame many difficulties"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Number System Overview - Japanese numbers Native vs Sino Numbers - Two systems Counter System Basics - How counters work 個 (こ) counter - Small objects いくつ (ikutsu) - How many Quantity expressions - Expressing amounts Specific counters - When to use what
